events.title: Trump publicly pushes Attorney General Pam Bondi to prosecute his political foes
events.summary: President Donald Trump exerted public pressure Saturday night on Attorney General Pam Bondi, saying it was time for the Justice Department to take action against a number of his political foes

events.title: The H-1B Visa: Why Is Trump Adding a $100,000 Fee?
events.summary: President Trump signed a proclamation on Friday adding a $100,000 fee to visas for skilled foreign workers. Immigration hard-liners have criticized the program for replacing American workers.

events.summary: The president delivered impassioned — if scientifically dubious — remarks about what he described as one of “the most alarming public health developments in history.”

events.title: Mamdani Lands Endorsement From Kamala Harris, His Biggest Yet
events.summary: “I support the Democrat in the race,” Ms. Harris said during an interview with Rachel Maddow. She added of the Democratic Party, “we’ve got a big tent and we’ve got a lot of stars.”

topHeadline: Trump Cancels Meeting with Democrats, Bringing Shutdown Closer
snippet: President Trump canceled a planned meeting with congressional Democrats ahead of the looming government funding deadline, escalating the risk of a shutdown.
lead: President Trump canceled a planned meeting with congressional Democrats ahead of the looming government funding deadline, escalating the risk of a shutdown.

events.title: Trump Cancels Meeting with Democrats, Bringing Shutdown Closer
events.summary: Trump cited “unserious and ridiculous” demands by Democrats, calling off a crucial meeting meant to negotiate spending before the fiscal year ends September 30.

events.title: Trump Scraps Meeting with Democrats, Raising Government Shutdown Risk
events.summary: By canceling talks with top Democrats, Trump intensifies the standoff over funding and raises stakes for a partial government shutdown.

events.title: At UN, President Trump Champions Sovereignty, Rejects Globalism
events.summary: In his address to the 80th session of the UN General Assembly, Trump pushed back against globalism and framed a vision of sovereign nations resisting interference.

events.title: Trump Claims Acetaminophen Use Linked to Autism, Draws Backlash
events.summary: Trump advised pregnant women to limit use of acetaminophen, claiming it raises autism risk—remarks swiftly denounced by medical experts as unscientific.

events.title: White House lays groundwork for mass government firings if there's a shutdown
events.summary: The Office of Management and Budget says in a memo that agencies should prepare reduction-in-force plans to accompany furloughs if a spending bill isn't passed next week.

events.title: A Federal Shutdown May Be Imminent. How Would It Affect the Economy?
events.summary: Congress and the White House have days to fund the government and avert a disruptive and potentially costly lapse in funding.

events.title: Right-wing terror attacks plunged in 2025, while left-wing attacks ticked up: study
events.summary: From 2011 through 2024, an average of 20 right-wing terror incidents took place each year, compared to an average of nearly three left-wing incidents annually.

events.title: Trump’s pick of former attorney in Virginia fuels concerns over political influence
events.summary: President Trump appointed former personal attorney Lindsey Halligan as U.S. attorney in Virginia after a veteran prosecutor resigned over resisting charges against James Comey. The move has raised co…

topHeadline: James Comey indicted amid sweeping political maneuvers
snippet: Ex-FBI Director James Comey was indicted on charges of making false statements to Congress and obstruction of justice, launching a dramatic escalation in the Trump-era legal and political wars.
lead: Former FBI Director James Comey was indicted by a federal grand jury on charges of making false statements to Congress and obstruction of justice. The move drew sharp criticism from Democrats, warnings about politicization of justice, and support from Trump allies who framed it as accountability.

events.title: Comey indicted on false statement and obstruction charges
events.summary: A federal grand jury formally charged James Comey with one count of making a false statement to Congress and one count of obstruction of justice. Media reports indicate that the indictment is tied to his 2020 testimony on Trump’s actions during the Russia probe and internal DOJ disputes.

events.title: Trump unveils aggressive new tariffs on drugs, trucks, furniture
events.summary: President Trump announced sweeping new tariffs: a 100 % tariff on imported pharmaceuticals, 25 % on heavy-duty trucks, and 50 % on kitchen cabinets and furniture. Critics say the move could dramatically raise consumer prices and worsen trade relations.

events.title: Assata Shakur, fugitive Black activist, dies in Cuba at 78
events.summary: Assata Shakur—convicted in 1977 for killing a New Jersey state trooper and long since exiled in Cuba—died at age 78. Cuban authorities cited health issues and advanced age. Her death reignited debates over race, justice, and U.S.–Cuba relations.

events.title: Trump to meet with top congressional leaders as a government shutdown looms
events.summary: President Donald Trump will meet with the top four congressional leaders at the White House on Monday as the clock draws nearer to a potential government shutdown.

events.title: Giuliani and Dominion Voting Systems Settle $1.3 Billion Defamation Suit
events.summary: The election technology company Dominion Voting Systems had accused Rudolph W. Giuliani of waging “a viral disinformation campaign” over the 2020 election.

topHeadline: Republicans press Democrats to accept short-term bill as shutdown looms
snippet: GOP leaders urged Senate Democrats to accept a brief stopgap to keep the government open while longer talks continue, as the White House floated aggressive belt-tightening options if funding lapses.
lead: With a shutdown days away, congressional Republicans pushed for a short-term funding bill and blamed Democrats for the impasse, while reporting indicated the administration was exploring ‘backdoor’ cuts that could bite even without new legislation.

events.title: Republicans urge Democrats to agree to short-term bill to keep government open
events.summary: GOP leaders said a temporary measure was needed before the Tuesday night deadline and warned thousands of federal workers could be furloughed if talks fail.

events.title: Report: 'Backdoor' funding cuts possible as shutdown fight intensifies
events.summary: The administration examined ways to reduce spending administratively if Congress does not act, escalating the standoff over budget priorities.

events.title: Trump says he’ll tell U.S. military leaders 'we love them' ahead of meeting
events.summary: The president previewed remarks to top military brass as Washington braced for a possible funding lapse midweek.

topHeadline: Vance says U.S. ‘headed to a shutdown’ as Senate eyes Tuesday vote
snippet: After White House talks, Vice President J.D. Vance said a shutdown looked likely, while Senate leaders teed up a vote for Tuesday with key policy disputes unresolved.
lead: Negotiations produced no breakthrough as the administration released sharper shutdown contingencies and Senate leaders planned a last-ditch vote for the final day before funding expires.

events.title: Vance warns U.S. is ‘headed to a shutdown’ after meeting with Democrats
events.summary: The vice president’s remarks underscored the widening gap over healthcare and other riders in the funding fight.

events.title: Top Senate Republican says chamber will vote Tuesday to avert shutdown
events.summary: Leaders set up a procedural vote, but the measure faced an uphill path given Democratic opposition to GOP-only terms.

events.title: Agencies detail shutdown plans; mass-firing threat looms in guidance
events.summary: Departments outlined furloughs and paused services, with new guidance signaling the administration could use a lapse to shrink the federal workforce.

events.title: Schumer and Thune Spar as Government Shutdown Nears

events.title: In Some States, Strapped Counties Must Impose Trump’s Medicaid Cuts
events.summary: The president’s domestic policy law created complex new work requirements for Medicaid and food stamps, but left the states to administer them. Colorado pushes that burden to its counties.

topHeadline: For Workers, Mixed Signals. For the Public, Limited Impact on Shutdown’s First Day.

events.title: Activists say Israeli navy intercepted nine boats from aid flotilla headed to Gaza
events.summary: The Israeli navy on Wednesday intercepted an aid flotilla bound for Gaza that was being closely watched around the world through their social media posts, according to activists within the flotilla.

events.title: The Be-Careful-What-You-Wish-For Shutdown
events.summary: Unlike in shutdowns past, President Trump is the wild card.

events.title: Statue of Trump and Epstein holding hands returns to the National Mall
events.summary: A statue featuring President Donald Trump alongside convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein has reappeared in front of the Capitol after being removed last week.

topHeadline: Senate Fails to Advance Funding Bill as Shutdown Enters Third Day
snippet: The Senate failed yet again to advance a stopgap funding measure, deepening the federal shutdown and escalating partisan tensions.
lead: On day three of the government shutdown, Senate Republicans were unable to reach the 60-vote threshold to move forward their appropriations bill, while Democrats held their ground on demands tied to healthcare subsidies.

events.title: Senate Vote Fails Again on Stopgap Funding, Shutdown Persists
events.summary: On Oct. 3, the Senate failed to advance a Republican-backed continuing resolution, prolonging the federal government shutdown. Democrats rejected moving forward without inclusion of healthcare subsidies.

events.title: Trump Readies Layoffs as Hopes for Swift Resolution Fade
events.summary: With no breakthrough in sight, the White House signaled it may begin mass layoffs of federal workers unless the shutdown is resolved soon.

events.title: Judiciary Warns It May Not Sustain Operations Past Oct. 3
events.summary: The U.S. judiciary’s internal memo indicated that without new appropriations, many federal courts may have to curtail staff operations after Oct. 3, threatening legal backlogs.

events.title: Trump Nominated for Nobel Peace Prize Again, Experts Skeptical
events.summary: President Trump received another Nobel Peace Prize nomination, though analysts broadly view it as symbolic and unlikely to succeed this year.

events.title: Hegseth Announces Strike Killing Four on Venezuelan Vessel
events.summary: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth announced that a U.S. strike on a vessel off the Venezuelan coast killed four, claiming it was trafficking narcotics toward the U.S.

events.title: Hamas Accepts Hostage Release Terms, Trump Issues Deadline
events.summary: On Oct. 3, Hamas declared willingness to hand over governance of Gaza to technocrats and release hostages, while rejecting full disarmament. Trump set a deadline of Oct. 5 for acceptance.
